<entry name="AcquireTileDescription" value="Before constructing additional buildings, you must first claim another tile. Click “Acquire Tile” and select a tile with at least 1 building slot. This process will take a few turns."/>
<entry name="AreaOrderUnitsDescription" value="[] to order all units within 3 tiles of the target enemy to attack it."/>
<entry name="BleedDescription" value="Bleed damages ground units each turn—don’t stay inside for too long."/>
<entry name="CameraDescription" value="Welcome to post-apocalyptic Earth. To move the camera, press over terrain and move your mouse."/>
<entry name="CloseQuartersFireDescription" value="Militants wield weapons with Close-Quarters Fire and attack at double rate at range 1. Consider your positioning before attacking."/>
<entry name="CachesDescription" value="Caches of Human, Voice and Cyber supplies are scattered throughout the map. Move a unit onto a cache to collect its contents."/>
<entry name="CommunicationsDescription" value="The Communications screen lets you manage diplomacy with other players: call or block them, declare war, forge or end pacts, shift relations through gifts, praise or denunciations, and even influence their ties with other factions."/>
<entry name="ConstructInfantryBuildingDescription" value="Construct unit production buildings to reinforce your struggling presence. Click “Barracks” and select a valid tile to start construction there. This will take several turns."/>
<entry name="CoverDescription" value="Forests, ruins, outposts and cities grant ranged damage reduction for non-large units. Take cover when you can."/>
<entry name="DamageCapDescription" value="A weapon’s damage exceeds the hitpoints of a single member of the target enemy, which causes any excess to be wasted."/>
<entry name="DamageCalculationDescription" value="There are a few important concepts to understand about damage calculation.
Each unit has a number of identical group members, with the unit’s total hitpoints being composed of the hitpoints of each individual group member. When a unit loses hitpoints equivalent to a group member, that member dies and no longer contributes its weapons to attacks, effectively reducing inflicted damage by the fraction that squad member represents. Healing the unit will bring the group member back to life, restoring the unit’s power. Units with only 1 squad member, such as large units, become damaged when below 50% hitpoints which reduces their accuracy by 33%.
When calculating a weapon’s final inflicted damage, the weapon’s damage value is first capped by the target unit’s group member hitpoints. That means a single attack of a weapon can never do more damage than there are hitpoints for an individual member in the target group. That is, a 6 damage weapon against a Militants group where each Militant has 2 hitpoints can never deal more than 2 damage. For single group member units, such as large units, this is irrelevant as their total hitpoints equals their member hitpoints.
After the hitpoints cap, attacks, accuracy and the target’s armor and other damage reductions are all applied multiplicatively.
Attacks specifies the number of attacks a weapon makes against its target when the unit attacks. This is the most valuable stat to increase, because it scales the damage after the hitpoints cap. And unlike accuracy it is unbounded in the upper limit.
Accuracy can range from 2 to 12, each point being 1/12 or 0.083 that is multiplied into the final damage value. It cannot be decreased below 2 or increased above 12.
Armor and other damage reductions (cover, evasion, city, invulnerable) of the same type are added together and then each reduce the damage by their corresponding factor multiplicatively, but no individual type can reduce the damage by more than 10/12 or 83%. Armor penetration indicates how many points of armor are ignored. Unless specifically mentioned otherwise, all damage reductions apply to both melee and ranged weapons.
Traits are built on top of and use these elementary concepts. For example, weapons with the splash trait gain additional attacks for each extra living member in the target group, and weapons with the ignore cover trait ignore cover damage reduction of the target unit.
Some consequences of all this:
Increasing the damage of a weapon may not increase the inflicted damage.
Infantry are tankier than their hitpoints might indicate. Single attack high damage non-splash weapons won’t be able to kill more than 1 group member. And at full hitpoints won’t even be able to kill 1 group member unless the weapon has 100% accuracy.
To kill infantry, it’s better to have high accuracy, more attacks or splash.
Hitpoint gains from leveling are less useful for low hitpoints group members. The increase in hitpoints is canceled out by the increase in group member hitpoints cap, making it worthless against weapons that already exceed the cap.
Healing is more valuable on infantry.
Modifying low accuracy by a flat amount is more valuable than modifying high accuracy. E.g. increasing accuracy from 6 to 8 (50% to 67%) is a 33% damage increase. However, increasing accuracy from 8 to 10 (67% to 83%) is a 25% damage increase.
Damage reduction of the same type has increasing returns. E.g. increasing armor from 0 to 1 will only give an (12-0)/(12-1)=+9% increase in survivability. However, increasing armor from 9 to 10 will give a (12-9)/(12-10)=+50% increase in survivability."/>
<entry name="EngineersDescription" value="To found additional cities, you'll have to research and produce Engineers."/>
<entry name="EnterCityDescription" value="Enter the city by clicking on the city headquarters tile again."/>
<entry name="EquipItemDescription" value="click an item to equip it on your hero. Newly equipped items go on a 1 turn cooldown before being usable."/>
<entry name="FallenSoldierDescription" value="You are playing as the Fallen Soldier, a Human-affinity leader whose units heal each turn thanks to , but are more expensive to maintain because of . Through research, you can unlock more of your leader’s unique properties."/>
<entry name="FoundCityDescription" value="Engineers can found cities. To establish your first city, click “Found City” and select a tile."/>
<entry name="HabitationBlocksDescription" value="Each building except the headquarters requires 1 population to operate. It's critical to research and construct Habitation Blocks to increase your city's housing (population limit)."/>
<entry name="HealingDescription" value="The unit has suffered significant damage. To heal, it must stay still and not participate in combat. Click “Hold Position Until Healed” to wait until it is back at full strength. Consider retreating to a friendly outpost or city tile where healing is accelerated."/>
<entry name="HousingDescription" value="The city's housing is full. Construct Habitation Blocks to increase the amount of living space and allow your population to grow again."/>
<entry name="LoyaltyDescription" value="Negative loyalty is decreasing the city's resource output. Research and construct a Holo Theater to keep your population working effectively."/>
<entry name="MarkTilesDescription" value=""/>
<entry name="MassOrderUnitsDescription" value="[] to order all units or [] to order all idle units to move to a target tile or attack a target enemy."/>
<entry name="MoraleDescription" value="The unit has taken a hit to morale from the loss of nearby allies. This will reduce their performance in combat. To recover, keep them out of combat or kill enemy units."/>
<entry name="MovementDescription" value="Move the unit by pressing . Each unit can only move once per turn inside the green area. Cliffs, which are only traversable by titans and flying units, are represented by orange lines."/>
<entry name="NPCsDescription" value="Three non-player leaders are also fighting for supremacy: Anchorite, Chieftess and ZEPHON. Peace with them allows you to ask for their support. Good standing may unlock additional choices in quests."/>
<entry name="OperationsDescription" value="Operations, shown in the top-left of the screen, are map-wide abilities with limited uses, earned as rewards or produced in your cities. Because they have an upkeep cost, you can dismantle them with a click if you do not plan to use them."/>
<entry name="OutpostsDescription" value="Capture outposts to increase your resource gain. When within cities, they also grant % bonuses to the entire city. Some outposts also provide bonuses to the stationed unit or grant rewards at regular intervals."/>
<entry name="OverwatchDescription" value="Units with actions remaining will fire overwatch shots at enemies that enter their red attack area. Consider disabling overwatch if you don't want to unleash neutral units."/>
<entry name="LeaderAbilitiesDescription" value="Each leader has unique abilities that cost influence to activate, displayed in the top-left of the screen. Some of these powers can also be earned through quests. Use them at the right moment to maximize your chances of success."/>
<entry name="PopulationDescription" value="The city’s population is too low to operate all buildings at full efficiency. Click to disable a nonessential building."/>
<entry name="ProduceUnitsDescription" value="Start Militant production in the Barracks. Other buildings can keep producing at the same time. If you construct additional Barracks, units will finish training faster."/>
<entry name="ReconDescription" value="Many units have activatable abilities. Outriders and Sharpshooters can reveal everything within 3 tiles with the Recon ability."/>
<entry name="ResearchLaboratoryDescription" value="It’s valuable to unlock the construction of Research Laboratories to increase your research speed."/>
<entry name="TheConcordatDescription" value="You can buy and sell resources and hero items at any time at The Concordat."/>
<entry name="TransportsDescription" value="Transports can carry non-large units as cargo. Embarked units heal inside, but if the transport is destroyed, the cargo dies with it."/>
<entry name="SelectionDescription" value="click on a unit to select it."/>
<entry name="UnitLevelsDescription" value="Kills made within 3 tiles of a unit grant it experience. All units gain levels, but heroes also gain special abilities that you can choose on level-up."/>
<entry name="WinningDescription" value="To win, either defeat all other players or unite everyone under one alliance. In the introduction, you only need to defeat the Heartless Artificer."/>

<entry name="Loading/35" value=""/> <entry name="Loading/36" value=""/> <entry name="Loading/37" value="Influence: "/> <entry name="Loading/38" value="Press [] to show tile information on all tiles."/> <entry name="Loading/39" value="[] building icons on tiles to toggle building power at will, freeing population and building input resources."/> <entry name="Loading/40" value="[] building icons on tiles to demolish buildings."/>
<entry name="Loading/43" value=""/>
<entry name="Loading/47" value="Units that have actions remaining have the icon visible on them."/>
<entry name="Loading/54" value="[] to mark tiles for yourself and your allies. AI allies will tend to move their units towards your markers."/> <entry name="Loading/55" value=""/>
<entry name="Loading/61" value="[] to order all idle units."/> <entry name="Loading/62" value="[] to order all units."/> <entry name="Loading/63" value="[] to order all units in the area (radius 3)."/>
